result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert Alexandru Crnkovich

Defendant Robert Alexandru Crnkovich in court.  Attorney Travis Schwantes Brett Lee Copeland in court for Robert Alexandru Crnkovich.  Attorney Ryan Michaels in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a plea and sentencing hearing. Case is no longer in a resolution posture. Defense counsel requests a bail/bond hearing. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

to modify bond, filed.

Defendant Robert Alexandru Crnkovich not in court, in custody.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland appeared by video for Robert Alexandru Crnkovich.  Attorney Katie Bakunowicz appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defendant not produced. Defense counsel informs court that they have received discovery materials and an offer from the state. Further, defense is in a resolution posture and requests a Plea/Sentencing hearing. Case adjourned to Br 29.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 08-26-2022, filed.
Case set for a scheduling conference on 7/29/22 at 8:30 am. Court is down and unable to hear the matter. Case is rescheduled for 8/26/22 at 8:30 am. Parties notified via email.

Attorney Brett Lee Copeland in court.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
MATTER HEARD OFF THE RECORD. Defense counsel requests an additional scheduling conference.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 06-28-2022, filed.

Defendant Robert Alexandru Crnkovich in court with attorney Brett Lee Copeland.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Mitchell Kriz - Wauwatosa Police Officer. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 6.2.22, filed.

Defendant Robert Alexandru Crnkovich in court with attorney Brett Lee Copeland.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. State's witness is present. Defendant appears via phone only. Court finds CAUSE to adjourn the preliminary hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29. Calendar call on March 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Robert Alexandru Crnkovich not in court.  Samuel Tufford appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next court date.  Court finds CAUSE to adjourn the preliminary hearing. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Calendar call scheduled for March 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 2.22.22, filed.
No Contact Order signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $4,000.00.  If Alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with SJW (6/14/00).

Defendant Robert Alexandru Crnkovich in court with attorney Zoe Plovanich.  Defendant Robert Alexandru Crnkovich in custody.  Mark O Thomson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Robert Alexandru Crnkovich appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer Branch 29.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
